class polls.models.Choice(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: Model

Model representing a choice for a question in the database.

Parameters:

models.Model (class) – The base class for all Django database models.

Variables:

  • question (ForeignKey) – The associated question for the choice.

  • choice_text (CharField) – The text of the choice.

  • votes (IntegerField) – The number of votes for the choice, default is 0.

Returns:

A string representation of the choice.

Return type:

str

objects = <django.db.models.manager.Manager object>
question

Accessor to the related object on the forward side of a many-to-one or one-to-one (via ForwardOneToOneDescriptor subclass) relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Child.parent is a ForwardManyToOneDescriptor instance.

exception DoesNotExist

Bases: ObjectDoesNotExist

exception MultipleObjectsReturned

Bases: MultipleObjectsReturned

choice_set

Accessor to the related objects manager on the reverse side of a many-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Parent.children is a ReverseManyToOneDescriptor instance.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

get_next_by_pub_date(*, field=<django.db.models.fields.DateTimeField: pub_date>, is_next=True, **kwargs)
get_previous_by_pub_date(*, field=<django.db.models.fields.DateTimeField: pub_date>, is_next=False, **kwargs)

polls.views.detail(request, question_id)[source]

Renders a view to display the details of a specific question.

Parameters:

  • request – The HTTP request object.

  • question_id – The ID of the question to display.

Returns:

A rendered HTML page displaying the question details.

Renders a view to display a list of the latest questions.

Parameters:

request – The HTTP request object.

Returns:

A rendered HTML page displaying the latest questions.

polls.views.results(request, question_id)[source]

Renders a view to display the results of a specific question.

Parameters:

  • request – The HTTP request object.

  • question_id – The ID of the question to display results for.

Returns:

A rendered HTML page displaying the question results.

polls.views.vote(request, question_id)[source]

Handles user voting on a specific question by updating the vote count.

Parameters:

  • request – The HTTP request object.

  • question_id – The ID of the question being voted on.

Returns:

An HTTP redirect to the results page for the voted question.
